flashcards.question: What is a notary public?
flashcards.answer: An official authorized to perform legal formalities
flashcards.explanation: A notary public is a person authorized by the state to witness signatures and deter fraud

audio.title: Notary Basics Overview
audio.description: Complete overview of notary public fundamentals

flashcards.question: What documents cannot be notarized without the signer present?
flashcards.explanation: California law requires the signer to appear personally before the notary for all notarizations

audio.title: Legal Requirements Deep Dive
audio.description: Detailed discussion of California notary legal requirements

flashcards.question: What is the maximum fee a California notary can charge per signature?
flashcards.explanation: As of 2023 California notaries can charge up to $15 per signature for acknowledgments and jurats

audio.title: Fee Structure Explanation
audio.description: Understanding notary fees and billing practices

chapters.title: Document Types
chapters.description: Different types of documents and requirements
